greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = the number of positive divisors of n which are coprime to sigma(n) = A000203(n).
comment: In the first 1000 terms, only 69 are odd. - _Harvey P. Dale_, Jul 16 2016
link: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
example: The sum of the positive divisors of 12 is 1+2+3+4+6+12 = 28. There are 2 positive divisors (1 and 3) of 12 which are coprime to 28. So a(12) = 2.
maple: with(numtheory): a:=proc(n) local div,ct,j: div:=divisors(n): ct:=0: for j from 1 to tau(n) do if igcd(div[j],sigma(n))=1 then ct:=ct+1 else ct:=ct fi od: ct: end: seq(a(n),n=1..140); # _Emeric Deutsch_, May 05 2007
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Apr 16 2007
